title: What are the different types of surveillance? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends. thats a very vauge question. Different types of surveillance for different organizations. law enforcement. military, Sports teams, Politicians etc. Military has spy cameras, electronic surveillance like checking radar waves and listening for radio communications etc. Law enforcement does sting operations for drug dealing, Hookers and Johns, drunk driving checkpoints, looking for underage sex activity online etc. the IRS looks at financial transactions of people they are auditing etc. Sports teams look at opposing team game films, watch media reports on injuries etc. To plan for future games against their opponents. Politicians? In America’s political climate? they all do opposition research. They look for any and every scandal to hammer their opponent. they have their people listen to opposing media and press conferences looking for that “GOTCHA” moment in time.

Overt and Covert come to mind. Overt surveillance is common in an industrial setting where production is monitored for quantity and quality as well as operations being monitored for safety, efficiency, etc. A cop sitting radar on the side of the road is generally overt with the intent to bring traffic closer to compliance and punish offenders. Covert would be more common for military, strategic, or criminal activity deterrence or crime solving. Low end might be a nanny cam. High end is probably above anything I can comprehend.
